title: Death of a Critic
description: Reflects on the internal struggle against self-censorship and the debilitating voice of an inner critic. Chronicles the journey of dismantling this barrier to cultivate a mental space for free expression. Marks a pivotal decision to publish work in defiance of perfectionism and fear.

title: Pragmatic Altruism
description: Examines the intersection of cynicism, pragmatism, and altruism as competing frameworks for navigating existence. Proposes a systematic application of science and engineering to transcend natural limitations and foster a more ethical world. Concludes that empowering others to determine their own moral direction is the optimal altruistic strategy.

title: Sports Bar
description: Narrates a tense dining experience that highlights the friction between personal ethics and social expectations. Explores the internal conflict and cognitive dissonance experienced when unspoken values clash with established norms. Illustrates the often uncomfortable compromise required to maintain relationships across ideological divides.

title: The Challenge of Monologue
description: Investigates the inherent limitations of written monologue compared to the dynamic nature of interpersonal dialogue. Discusses the ethical risks of static publication, including potential misinterpretation and the inability to adapt to shifting cultural contexts. Frames the act of writing as a necessary leap of faith to foster connection across time and space.

title: The Cursed Cursor
description: Narrates the stream of consciousness of a Staff Software Engineer experiencing professional burnout. Juxtaposes the triviality of maintaining a text cursor against the corporate significance assigned to its implementation. Concludes with an existential reflection on the hollowness of modern technical labor.

title: The Lost Plot: Chapter 1
description: Rejects the plot of Lost and the hostile environment of the sun. Establishes 'Soup Physics' and 'Temporal Accords' to navigate a chaotic narrative before introducing 'The Box,' a vessel operating on detached timelines where events are ultimately pruned.

title: One or Many
description: Reflects on the decision to publish under a single, unified identity rather than using pseudonyms for different internal voices. Acknowledges the risks of vulnerability but prioritizes the integrity of a cohesive self, integrating professional, personal, and creative facets.

title: Into the Subverse
description: Explores the fundamental nature of causality, structure, and the concept of 'nothingness'. Questions why the universe follows laws and investigates the paradoxical relationship between order and chaos, suggesting that true understanding requires letting go of the need for structure.

title: Judgement vs Understanding
description: Contrasts the inherent human tendency to judge with the conscious effort required to understand. Argues that while judgement provides stability and safety, understanding opens the door to new perspectives and deeper truths. Concludes that both are necessary but serve different roles in navigating existence.

title: Meat, Because We Want To
description: Questions the underlying motivations for meat consumption, proposing that beyond cognitive dissonance and ideology, there may be a darker impulse to inflict suffering. Suggests that animals serve as convenient targets for human cruelty and that understanding this drive is key to preventing further abuse.
